tmrm_subject_map
[libtmrm public routines]

Detailed Description

tmrm_subject_map respresents an instance of a subject map.

Function Documentation

tmrm_proxy* tmrm_subject_map_bottom ( tmrm_subject_map *  map  ) 

Returns the bottom proxy of the subject map.

This proxy can be used for bootstrapping purposes. If bottom does not exist, it will be created.

int tmrm_subject_map_export_to_yaml ( tmrm_subject_map *  map,
FILE *  fh 
)

Serializes the subject map m to a file.

Returns:
-1 on failure

void tmrm_subject_map_free ( tmrm_subject_map *  m  ) 

Frees the memory occupied by a subject map object.

m must not be NULL.

tmrm_multiset* tmrm_subject_map_is_value_by_key ( tmrm_multiset *  proxies,
tmrm_proxy *  key 
)

All proxies in which the proxies are the value for a particular key.

Is is the generalized version of the function. See tmrm_proxy_is_value_by_key() for details.

Notation: "PROXY <- KEY"

PHP-prototype: TMRM_SubjectMap::isValueByKey()

tmrm_subject_map* tmrm_subject_map_new ( tmrm_subject_map_sphere *  sms,
tmrm_storage *  storage,
const char *  label 
)

Constructor: Creates a new subject map with a label.

The memory occupied by the object has to be freed with tmrm_subject_map_free().

The function will always assure that the tmrm-bootstrapping-ontology is part of the subject map.

Parameters:
sms The subject map sphere that the subject map belongs to.
storage The backend that is used to store the subject map.
label A unique id that identfies the subject map in the subject map sphere that it belongs to. This may be a path name, a UUID, a URI.
Returns:
NULL on failure.

tmrm_multiset* tmrm_subject_map_proxies ( tmrm_subject_map *  map  ) 

Returns a multiset with all proxies in the subject map.

PHP-prototype: TMRM_SubjectMap::getProxies()

Returns:
NULL on error.
